data.title: 107 biggest comedy tours 2024: Get tickets for Jerry Seinfeld, Bill Burr, more
data.meta_description: We found tickets to see the 107 biggest comedians on tour in 2024 including Jerry Seinfeld, Kevin Hart, Sebastian Maniscalco, Nate Bargatze, Ali Wong, Talking Sopranos, John Cleese, Brett Goldstein.
data.text:
Comedy fans, 2024 is going to be your year.

Over the past few months, many of the biggest names in the game — Jerry Seinfeld, Bill Burr, Kevin Hart, Sebastian Maniscalco and Ali Wong — have announced major nationwide tours that will send them far and wide all over North America.

They’re not the only acts hitting the road, though.

Our team found 107 (!) major stand-ups, podcasters, improvisers, duo acts, “Saturday Night Live” cast members, authors, crowd work comics and storytellers likely headed to a venue in your neck of the woods in the very near future.

Plus, in May, over 300 (yes, you read that right) comedians are descending upon Los Angeles for the second Netflix is a Joke Festival.

Want to see who’s out and about these next few months?

You’re in the right place, chuckleheads.

Below, you’ll find the 107 biggest comedians on tour separated by sub-genres like household name headliners, ‘SNL’ cast members, ‘Daily Show’ alumni, up-and-comers and many more for your scrolling pleasure.

So sit back, relax and get ready to LOL, LMAO, ROFL and plain ol’ laugh.

Household Name Headliners

Jerry Seinfeld

Runs Jan. 5 through Sept. 7.

Known for Seinfeld, Comedians In Cars Getting Coffee and Bee Movie.

Kevin Hart’s ‘Reality Check Tour’

Runs Jan. 6 through June 23.

Known for Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle, The Upside and Get Hard.

John Mulaney’s ‘John Mulaney In Concert’

Runs Jan. 11 through May 4.

Known for Big Mouth, The Sack Lunch Bunch, Chip ‘n Dale: Rescue Rangers.

Bill Burr’s ‘Bill Burr Live Tour’

Runs Feb. 16 through July 21.

Known for Old Dads, F is for Family and The Mandalorian.

Chelsea Handler’s ‘Little Big B—- Tour’

Runs Jan. 19 through May 26.

Known for Chelsea Lately, Chelsea Does and Hello Privilege, It’s Me Chelsea.

Jeff Foxworthy

Runs Jan. 20 through June 14.

Known for The Blue Collar Comedy Tour, The Jeff Foxworthy Show and Are You Smarter Than a Fifth Grader?

Huge Co-Headliners

Tina Fey and Amy Poehler’s ‘Restless Leg Tour’

Runs Jan. 12 through Feb. 18.

Known for Saturday Night Live, Mean Girls and Baby Mama.

Steve Martin and Martin Short’s ‘The Dukes of Funnytown Tour’

Runs May 3 through June 15.

Known for Only Murders in the Building, Three Amigos and Father of the Bride.

Seth Meyers and John Oliver

Runs Jan. 12 through June 16.

Known for Late Night With Seth Meyers, Last Week Tonight and Strike Force Five.

Arena acts

Gabriel Iglesias’ ‘Don’t Worry Be Fluffy Tour’

Runs Feb. 14 through Aug. 4.

Known for Mr. Iglesias, Magic Mike XXL and Space Jam: A New Legacy.

Jim Gaffigan’s ‘Barely Alive Tour’

Runs Jan. 9 through May 2.

Known for The Jim Gaffigan Show, Super Troopers 2 and Chappaquiddick.

Katt Williams’ ’23 and Me Tour’

Runs Jan. 12 through May 11.

Known for Friday After Next, Scary Movie V and Norbit.

Nate Bargatze’s ‘Be Funny Tour’

Runs Jan. 11 through Aug. 9.

Known for hosting Saturday Night Live, Netflix’s The Standups and the “Nateland” podcast.

Sebastian Maniscalco’s ‘It Ain’t Right Tour’

Runs Jan. 13 through Dec. 15.

Known for About My Father, The Super Mario Bros. Movie and Bookie.

Bert Kreischer’s ‘Tops Off The World Tour’

Runs Jan. 18 through July 14.

Known for The Machine, The Cabin, 2 Bears 1 Cave podcast.

Tom Segura’s ‘Come Together Tour’

Runs Jan. 18 through June 15.

Known for 2 Bears 1 Cave podcast, Mostly Stories and Ball Hog.

Jo Koy’s ‘World Tour’

Runs Jan. 12 through May 3.

Known for hosting the 2024 Golden Globes, Easter Sunday and Chelsea Lately.

TV stars

Brett Goldstein’s ‘Second Best Night Of Your Life Tour’

Runs Jan. 18 through May 18.

Known for Ted Lasso, Shrinking and Films To Be Buried With.

Ilana Glazer’s ‘Ilana Glazer Live Tour’

Runs Jan. 18 through May 2.

Known for Broad City, The After Party and Rough Night.

George Lopez

Runs Jan. 13 through July 20.

Known for The George Lopez Show, Lopez vs. Lopez and Blue Beetle.

Ali Wong

Runs Feb. 17 through May 4.

Known for Beef, Always Be My Maybe and Tuca and Bertie.

Kevin James’ ‘The Irregardless Tour’

Runs Feb. 3 through June 29.

Known for King of Queens, Hitch and Paul Blart: Mall Cop.

DL Hughley

Runs Jan. 5 through July 21.

Known for The Original Kings of Comedy, The Hughleys and Dancing With The Stars.

John Cleese’s ‘An Evening with the late John Cleese Tour’

Runs April 1-8.

Known for Monty Python, Fawlty Towers and A Fish Called Wanda.

Pete Holmes

Runs Jan. 5 through May 4.

Known for Crashing, The Pete Holmes Show and You Made It Weird.

Ramy Youssef

Runs Jan. 19 through Feb. 18.

Known for Ramy, Poor Things and Mr. Robot.

Joe Gatto’s ‘Joe Gatto’s Night of Comedy Tour’

Runs Jan. 11 through March 24.

Known for Impractical Jokers, The Misery Index and Two Cool Moms.

Cristela Alonzo

Runs Jan. 20 through June 23.

Known for Cristela, Cars 3 and Middle Classy.

Talk show hosts

Jay Leno

Runs Jan. 12 through May 31.

Known for The Tonight Show, Jay Leno’s Garage and The Jay Leno Show.

Bill Maher’s ‘The WTF? Tour’

Runs Jan. 27 through Nov. 2.

Known for Real Time with Bill Maher, Politically Incorrect and Religulous.

Adam Carolla

Runs Jan. 5 through July 13.

Known for The Man Show, Ralph Breaks The Internet and Drawn Together.

Craig Ferguson’s ‘The Fancy Rascal Tour’

Runs

Known for The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson, How To Train Your Dragon 2 and Winnie the Pooh.

Nikki Glaser’s ‘The Good Girl Tour’

Runs Jan. 19 through Sept. 28.

Known for F Boy Island, Not Safe with Nikki Glaser and Nikki & Sarah Live.

“Saturday Night Live” cast

Pete Davidson

Runs Jan. 5-8.

Known for Bupkis, King of Staten Island and The Suicide Squad.

Colin Jost

Runs Feb. 16 through June 22.

Known for Tom and Jerry, A Punchable Face and Coming 2 America.

Tracy Morgan

Runs Feb. 2 through May 11.

Known for 30 Rock, The Last O.G. and The Tracy Morgan Show.

David Spade‘s ‘Catch Me Inside Tour’

Runs Jan. 12 through Sept. 28.

Known for Tommy Boy, Just Shoot Me and Joe Dirt.

Darrell Hammond

Runs Jan. 16-20.

Known for Scary Movie 3, Damages and Cracked Up: The Darrell Hammond Story.

Rob Schneider’s ‘I Have Issues Tour’

Runs Jan. 12 through March 17.

Known for Deuce Bigalow: Male Gigolo, The Hot Chick and The Waterboy.

Chris Redd

Runs Jan. 25 through May 3.

Known for Popstar: Never Stop Stopping, Kenan and Bust Down.

Kevin Nealon

Runs Jan. 19 through April 27.

Known for Weeds, Happy Gilmore and The Wedding Singer.

Jay Pharoah

Runs Jan. 5 through May 4.

Known for Family Guy, The Blackening and White Famous.

Marcello Hernandez

Runs Jan. 12 through March 16.

Known for Late Night with Seth Meyers, The Improviser and Nudes in the News.

Michael Longfellow

Runs Jan. 5 through May 12.

Known for Bring the Funny, Good Burger 2 and How To Be Broke.

“Daily Show” alumni

Trevor Noah’s ‘Off The Record Tour’

Runs Jan. 11 through May 11.

Known for hosting the Grammys, Born A Crime and Black Panther.

Lewis Black’s ‘Goodbye Yeller Brick Road, The Final Tour’

Runs Jan. 18 through May 4.

Known for Inside Out, Spongebob Squarepants and Accepted.

Hasan Minhaj’s ‘Off With His Head Tour’

Runs Jan. 12 through June 1.

Known for Patriot Act, The Morning Show and The White House Correspondents Dinner.

Ronny Chieng’s ‘The Love To Hate It Tour’

Runs Jan. 12 through July 13.

Known for Crazy Rich Asians, M3GAN and Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings.

Demetri Martin’s ‘The Joke Machine Tour’

Runs Jan. 26 through May 12.

Known for Important Things with Demetri Martin, Woodstock and Dean.

Roy Wood Jr.

Runs Jan. 10 through May 4.

Known for Sullivan & Son, Confess, Fletch and Flatbush Misdemeanors.

*Featuring Jordan Klepper on select dates.

Hard-hitting veteran headliners

Andrew Dice Clay

Runs Jan. 19 through April 6.

Known for The Adventures of Ford Fairlane, Blue Jasmine and A Star Is Born.

Brian Regan

Runs Jan. 10 through June 21.

Known for The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon, Loudermilk and three Netflix specials.

Wanda Sykes’ ‘Please & Thank You Tour’

Runs Feb. 24 through June 15.

Known for The Other Two, History of the World Pt. II and Pootie Tang.

Marlon Wayans’ ‘Microphone Fiend Tour’

Runs Jan. 5 through March 8.

Known for Scary Movie, White Chicks and Requiem For A Dream.

Anthony Jeselnik’s ‘Bones And All Tour’

Runs Jan. 11 through May 10.

Known for The Jeselnik Offensive, Comedy Central Roasts and Last Comic Standing.

Dave Attell

Runs Jan. 12 through April 7.

Known for Insomniac, Trainwreck and Arrested Development.

Leanne Morgan’s ‘Just Getting Started Tour’

Runs Jan. 6 through June 29.

Known for Sun Moon, I’m Every Woman and the Sweaty and Pissed podcast.

Russell Peters’ ‘Act Your Age World Tour’

Runs Jan. 4 through June 15.

Known for Hip-Hop Evolution, Russell Peters vs. The World and Last Comic Standing.

Eddie Griffin’s ‘Live and Unleashed Tour’

Runs Jan. 12 through April 20.

Known for Undercover Brother, John Q and Norbit.

Ron White

Runs Jan. 11 through April 20.

Known for The Blue Collar Comedy Tour, Horrible Bosses and Sex and the City 2.

‘We Them Ones Comedy Tour’

Runs Feb. 2 through May 12.

Featuring Mike Epps, DeRay Davis, DC Young Fly, Chico Bean,

Karlous Miller, Lil Duval and Mojo Brookzz.

Tom Papa’s ‘On Tour’

Runs Jan. 12 through April 6.

Known for The Marriage Ref, The Informant! and Bee Movie.

Maz Jobrani’s ‘Mr. International Comedy Tour’

Runs Jan. 12 through Feb. 10.

Known for Friday After Next, Better Off Ted and 13 Going On 30.

Luenell’s ‘The Fresh Out of Favors Comedy Tour‘

Runs Jan. 1 through May 16.

Known for Borat, That’s My Boy and The Rock.

Alt-comedy icons

Marc Maron’s ‘All In Tour’

Runs Jan. 9 through June 22.

Known for WTF, Maron and To Leslie.

Eddie Izzard in “Hamlet”

Runs Feb. 2-10.

Known for Ocean’s Thirteen, Across The Universe and Mystery Men.

Paula Poundstone

Runs Jan. 19 through Oct. 19.

Known for A Prairie Home Companion, Wait Wait.. Don’t Tell Me and The Paula Poundstone Show.

Patton Oswalt’s ‘Who’s Ready To Laugh Tour’

Runs Jan. 14 through Feb. 24.

Known for King of Queens, Ratatouille and Young Adult.

Margaret Cho’s ‘Live & Livid Tour’

Runs Feb. 6 through April 11.

Known for All-American Girl, 30 Rock and Fire Island.

Mike Birbiglia’s ‘Please Stop The Ride Tour’

Runs Jan. 19 through June 29.

Known for Orange Is The New Black, Sleepwalk With Me and Don’t Think Twice.

Maria Bamford

Runs Feb. 7 through March 27.

Known for Lady Dynamite, Bojack Horseman and Adventure Time.

Gary Gulman’s ‘Born On 3rd Base Tour‘

Runs Jan. 20 through May 5.

Known for Last Comic Standing, Life & Beth and Joker.

Janeane Garofalo

Runs Jan. 5-27.

Known for Mystery Men, Wet Hot American Summer and The Larry Sanders Show.

Todd Barry’s ‘Half Joking Tour’

Runs Jan. 10 through Feb. 24.

Known for The Wrestler, Bob’s Burgers and Louie.

Edgy acts

Andrew Schulz’s ‘The Life Tour’

Runs Jan. 12 through May 4.

Known for You People, White Men Can’t Jump and Sneaky Pete.

Jimmy Carr’s ‘Terribly Funny Tour’

Runs March 16 through June 29.

Known for Roast Battle, Drunk History and The Fix.

Shane Gillis

Runs Jan. 12 through May 11.

Known for Bupkis, Matt and Shane’s Secret Show and Gilly and Keeves.

Theo Von’s ‘Return Of The Rat Tour’

Runs Feb. 1-9.

Known for ‘This Past Weekend’ podcast, Road Rules and TigerBelly.

Sam Jay

Runs Jan. 18 through March 30.

Known for writing for Saturday Night Live, Bust Down and Pause with Sam Jay.

Sam Morril’s ‘The Class Act Tour’

Runs Jan. 4 through March 8.

Known for America’s Got Talent, The Late Show with Stephen Colbert and Joker.

Mark Normand’s ‘Ya Don’t Say Tour’

Runs Jan. 12 through May 3.

Known for Horace and Pete, Inside Amy Schumer and Soups To Nuts Netflix special.

Jim Jefferies’ ‘Give ’em What They Want Tour’

Runs Jan. 12 through Aug. 31.

Known for Legit, Reno 911: It’s A Wonderful Heist and Killing Hasslehoff.

Stavros Halkias’ ‘The Fat Rascal Tour’

Runs Jan. 27 through Feb. 3.

Known for Pause with Sam Jay, Cum Town and Salesmen.

Nimesh Patel’s ‘Fast & Loose Tour’

Runs Jan. 11 through June 2.

Known for writing for Saturday Night Live, Verified Stand-Up and writing for The Oscars.

Big Jay Oakerson

Runs Jan. 5 through Sept. 21.

The future of stand-up comedy

Matt Rife’s ‘ProbleMATTic Tour’

Runs Jan. 31 through Sept. 7.

Known for Wild ‘N Out, Bring The Funny, Netflix special Natural Selection.

Taylor Tomlinson’s ‘The Have It All Tour’

Runs March 22 through May 9.

Known for hosting @Midnight, Last Comic Standing and Netflix special Quarter-Life Crisis.

Brad Williams

Runs Jan. 6 through Aug. 31.

Known for Mascots, Deadbeat, The Degenerates

Atsuko Okatsuka’s ‘Full Grown Tour’

Runs Jan. 10 through Feb. 16.

Known for Spider Man: Across The Spider Verse, History of the World: Part II and Room 104.

Joe List

Runs Jan. 11 through Aug. 10.

Known for Fourth of July, Netflix’s The Standups and Tuesdays with Stories.

Beth Stelling

Runs Jan. 25 through May 3.

Known for Rutherford Falls, Red Oaks and Netflix special If You Didn’t Want Me Then.

Fortune Feimster’s ‘Live Laugh Love Comedy Tour’

Runs Jan. 5 through May 18.

Known for Barb and Star Go to Vista Del Mar, The Mindy Project and RuPaul’s Drag Race.

Matteo Lane’s ‘The Al Dente Tour’

Runs Jan. 20 through April 17.

Known for Guy Code, Ladylike and Netflix’s The Comedy Lineup.

Kountry Wayne’s ‘The King Of Hearts Comedy Tour’

Runs March 15 through May 25.

Known for Wild ‘N Out, Holiday Heartbreak and Variety’s 2021 Comics to Watch.

Pete Lee’s ‘That Guy From That Thing Tour’

Runs Jan. 4 through April 13.

Known for The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon, Last Comic Standing and Best Week Ever.

Gianmarco Soresi’s ‘The Leaning In Tour’

Runs Jan. 4 through Oct. 5.

Known for The Late Late Show With James Corden, Here Today and Hustlers.

Daniel Sloss’ ‘HUBRiS Tour’

Runs April 11 through May 18.

Known for Drunk History UK, M.U.F.F. and HBO special X.

KevOnStage

Runs Feb. 2 through March 31.

Known for Funny In Real Life, Family Man and A Black Lady Sketch Show.

Unique comedy shows

David Sedaris

Runs April 2 through May 16.

Known for C.O.G., Holidays On Ice and Naked.

Impractical Jokers’ ‘Drive Drive Drive Drive Tour’

Runs Jan. 12 through June 23.

Featuring Sal Vulcano, Brian “Q” Quinn and James “Murr” Murray.

Jeff Dunham’s ‘Still Not Cancelled Tour’

Runs Jan. 10 through Dec. 8.

Known for The Jeff Dunham Show, 11 comedy specials and The Nut Job.

Talking Sopranos’ ‘In Conversation with The Sopranos’

Runs Feb. 25 through April 7.

Featuring Michael Imperioli, Steve Schirripa and Vincent Pastore.

Whose Line Is It Anyway’s ‘Whose Live Anyway Tour’

Runs Jan. 18 through Oct. 25.

Featuring Ryan Stiles, Greg Proops, Jeff B. Davis and Joel Murray.

Ben Schwartz’s ‘Ben Schwartz and Friends Tour’

Runs Jan. 19 through June 15.

Known for Sonic The Hedgehog, Parks and Recreation and The Afterparty.

Hannah Berner’s ‘I’m On Tour’

Runs Jan. 18 through May 10.

Known for Giggly Squad, Berner Phone and Summer House.

Randy Rainbow’s ‘For President Tour’

Runs Jan. 19 through May 5.

Known for Emmy nominated short form comedy, song parodies and RuPaul’s Drag Race.

Colin Mochrie and Brad Sherwood’s ‘Colin & Brad Live Tour’

Runs Jan. 4 through Aug. 18.

Known for Whose Line Is It Anyway, Almost Heroes and Kids In The Hall.

You’re still here after the check spot?

As a tip of the hat to you, check out our comprehensive feature on the 2024 Netflix is a Joke Festival.
